resources:
Madrid Tour Guide
monuments Puerta de Alcalà The Puerta de Alcalá is a Neo-classical monument in the Plaza de la Independencia in Madrid, Spai Plaza de la Independencia, 1, 28001 Madrid Open 24 hours
Palacio de cristal The Palacio de Cristal is a glass and metal structure located in Madrid\'s Buen Retiro Park. It was built in 1887 on the occasion of the Exposition of the Philippines, held in the same year, then a Spanish colonial possession
Paseo República de Cuba, 4, 28009 Madrid open: 10AM-10PM
Plaza Cibeles The Plaza de Cibeles is a square with a neo-classical complex of marble sculptures with fountains that has become an iconic symbol for the city of Madrid. It sits at the intersection of Calle de Alcalá, Paseo de Recoletos and Paseo del Prado. N/A
Palacio Real The Royal Palace of Madrid is the official residence of the Spanish Royal Family at the city of Madrid, but it is only used for state ceremonies.
Calle de Bailén, s/n, 28071 Madrid Open: 10AM-8PM
El Parque del Buen Retiro The Buen Retiro Park is one of the largest parks of the city of Madrid, Spain. The park belonged to the Spanish Monarchy until the late 19th century, when it became a public park. Plaza de la Independencia, 7, 28001 Madrid
open: 7AM-1AM
events Flamenco Madrid 2018 - 4ª edición Desde el teatro Fernán Gómez, Centro Cultural de la Villa, nos complace presentar la cuarta edición del Festival Flamenco Madrid, un proyecto artístico sostenible, a nivel social y cultural en el que la programación artística promueve el valor del talento de artistas emergentes y sobre todo, la singularidad de la mujer artista y creadora. En esta edidicón tienen cabida, como todos los años, espectáculos, exposiciones, coloquios, conferencias, clases magistrales... Flamenco Madrid, #ConMdeMujer, sueña con un cambio en nuestra sociedad a través de la cultura. PLAZA COLON, 4 28001 MADRID from 14th of May to the 10th of June
I Festival de Artes Escénicas 33 actuaciones de diferentes disciplinas artísticas: música en directo, teatro, danza y otros, a cargo de compañías fundamentalmente amateurs, trufadas de espectáculos profesionales. Se desarrollará en 12 emplazamientos, 7 de calles y 5 espacios cerrados, repartidos por los barrios del distrito. El objetivo es mostrar la riqueza de la actividad cultural del Distrito y activar espacios nuevos como el Espacio de Igualdad Elena Arnedo Soriano, o tradicionalmente carentes de oferta cultural, como el templete del Parque Roma o la Calle 12 de Octubre. Distrito del retiro From 24th of May to the 27th of May
Fiver 2018 Fundado en Logroño en 2012, FIVER es la plataforma más importante de apoyo, producción, formación, archivo y difusión de danza audiovisual basada en España. En su VI edición, FIVER ofrece una experiencia inmersiva en el mundo de la danza audiovisual compuesta de instalaciones, proyecciones, y muestras de videodanza internacionales repartidas, en un trayecto de libre circulación, por diversos espacios de Naves Matadero y Cineteca Madrid. Nave 10 -Sala Max Aub y Sala de Madera- y Cafetería Naves Proyecciones: 19, 20 y 26 mayo De martes a viernes de 17 a 20horas, sábado y domingo de 12 a 20 horas
Madrid, musa de las artes El Museo de Arte Contemporáneo de Madrid imaugura este jueves 24 de mayo, Madrid, musa de las artes, comisariada por Javier Pérez Segura. La exposición nos muestra un nuevo punto de vista sobre Madrid, como simbolo de acogida y de inspiración a lo largo del siglo XX. Museo de Arte Contemporáneo de Madrid La exposición estará abierta al público hasta el 4 de octubre de 2018.
restaurants Casa Botinmusa Sobrino de Botín, founded in 1725, is the oldest restaurant continuously operating in the world, according to the Guinness Book of Records. Calle Cuchilleros, 17, 28005 open at 1PM-4PM, 8PM-12AM
"Tablao Villa Rosa" Madrid has been and is the capital of flamenco since the early twentieth century. Artists of all kinds and condition to reach fame and prestige.5 minutes walking from Puerta del Sol
Plaza Sta. Ana, 15, 28012 Madrid open 11AM-1AM
mercado san miguel The Market of San Miguel is a covered market located in Madrid, Spain. Originally built in 1916, it was purchased by private investors in 2003 who renovated the iron structure and reopened it in 2009.
Plaza de San Miguel, s/n, 28005 Madrid open 10AM-1AM
Casa Labra Casa Labra is a pub in Madrid located close to the Puerta del Sol that was established and has been open since 1860. It is famous for being the site for the foundation of the Spanish Socialist Workers\'Party by Pablo Iglesias on May 2, 1879
Calle Tetuán, 12, 28013 Madrid Open: 11AM-3:30PM, 6PM-11PM
Lhrady Lhardy is a restaurant located at Madrid in Spain, which was opened in 1839 by Emilio Huguenin Lhardy. It was said to have introduced French haute cuisine to Madrid.
Carrera de S. Jerónimo, 8, 28014 Madrid Open 10AM-10PM
museums Mudeo Reina Sofia The Museo Nacional Centro de Arte Reina Sofía is Spain\'s national museum of 20th-century art. The museum was officially inaugurated on September 10, 1992, and is named for Queen Sofía. Calle de Santa Isabel, 52, 28012 Madrid Open: 10AM-9PM
Museum Thyssen The Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum, or simply the Thyssen, is an art museum in Madrid, Spain, located near the Prado Museum on one of city\'s main boulevards. Paseo del Prado, 8, 28014 Madrid open: 10AM-7PM
Museo Naval de Madrid The Museo Naval de Madrid —in English, Naval Museum of Madrid— is a national museum in Madrid, Spain. It shows the history of the Spanish Navy since the Catholic Monarchs, in the 15th century, up to the present
Paseo del Prado, 5, 28014 Madrid open: 10AM-7PM
Museo del Prado The Prado Museum is the main Spanish national art museum, located in central Madrid. It is widely considered to have one of the world\'s finest collections of European art, dating from the 12th century to the early 20th century, based on the former Spanish Royal Collection, and the single best collection of Spanish art.
Paseo del Prado, s/n, 28014 Madrid open: 10AM-8PM
Museo Arqueológico The National Archaeological Museum is a museum in Madrid, Spain. It is located on Serrano Street beside the Plaza de Colón, sharing its building with the National Library. Calle de Serrano, 13, 28001 Madrid Open: 9:30AM-8PM
